bibl.title: Letter from William A. Tansey to Emilie Lawrence Reed, March 10, 1929

div1.p: Tansey's cousins will lobby a Minnesota congressman on her behalf.

div1.head: Letter from William A. Tansey to Emilie Lawrence Reed, March 10, 1929
div1.opener:
WILLIAM A. TANSEY, M. D.
SANFORD AVENUE
NEWARK, N. J.
March 10, 1929
My dear Mrs Reed;
div1.p:
Your letter received and I immediately
mailed it out to my cousins in St. Paul,
Minn. together with explanations of your
case and asked them to intercede with
the Congressman Harold Knutson who is
holding it up. I am sure they will
do all they can for you and will let
us know as soon as possible and I'll
keep you informed.

My experience in the U. S. Army
taught me lots of things regarding the
doings of Gov. officials and swivel chair
holders so as the next time I go in the
Army they will have to make me a Major
General instead of a 1st Lieutenant otherwise
I stay home. They seem to think medical
men are of no consequence but the only
way medical men can handle them
is not to fall for their bait but to
keep practicing in their own good private
practice in which the sky is the limit
if they practice their profession well.

As for who sits in the WhiteHouse
it doesnt mean anything to you
or me the world goes on just the
same, the same old money powers
are in control, the some old army
of humanity are out of work or in
need of financial help for home and
families but we must make the best
of it and carry on. The Goody goods
think the rest of us are out of step
and are all going to hell but them, poor
hypocrites, and so they must turn the
world upside down and make the rest
of us behave, which cant be done and
if poor old Abraham Lincoln could come
back and see the force going on in the
country today he would not think it was
WILLIAM A. TANSEY, M. D.
420 SANFORD AVENUE
NEWARK, N. J.
3/
the same place he once lived.

As for the politicians the more I
see of them the less I like them and
the enormous amount of poor laws
they are cramming down our throats
every day both in state and nation
onare beginning to get under the skin of
every good votercitizen regardless of whatever
party he may belong,

Then we have to make the best of it
and keep on living after all our goodhealth
comes first and then we are in a position
to get the rest. Mrs Tansey was sick in
the hosp for 3 wks having had a pelvis
disorder which required some mind surgery
she came home the other day and is gradually
improving, she wishes to be remembered to
you. I'll do all I can to help your good
cause and whatever way I can serve you
let me know, I'll inform you as soon
as I receive word from the West.
